text:
Andrew Mark Cuomo (born December 6, 1957) is an American politician. He is the 56th and current Governor of New York.
He was 64th New York State Attorney General and the 11th United States Secretary of Housing and Urban Development under Bill Clinton.
He was born in Queens. His father Mario Cuomo was also Governor of New York and Andrew worked for him.
He was reelected governor in 2014. In 2020, he became well known across the country over his leadership and handling over the COVID-19 pandemic in New York.

annotations.surface_form: United States Secretary of Housing and Urban Development
